column1: Besides descriptions, there are two data for locks:
lockId - that is needed to check whether a key fits to a door lock. Doors with the same lockId can be opened with the same key.
doorLock - that can be either locked or unlocked. It handles the state of the door lock and for you it is important that this determines whether a door is locked after a map reload or not.
If you set a lockId but not dooLock, the default behaviour is used (that is, locked).
Doors with no locks do not needed either of those two data.

column5: locked on reload [false = open after reload; otherewise closed]
